meanings.definition: A group of enzymes that play a key role in lipid metabolism.
meanings.sent1: The lipins in our body help break down fats for energy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying how lipins affect our digestion of oils.
meanings.sent3: The lipins in the cells were having a party, celebrating their fat-burning abilities.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to lose weight was like the powerful action of lipins in the body.
meanings.sent5: The lipins worked tirelessly, like little fat detectives, solving the mystery of excess lipids.

meanings.definition: A type of protein involved in the regulation of lipid levels in the body.
meanings.sent1: The lipins in the blood help maintain a healthy balance of fats.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor lipins to ensure proper lipid control in patients.
meanings.sent3: The lipins at the gym were lifting weights to stay strong and keep fats in check.
meanings.sent4: Her body was a well-regulated system, thanks to the diligent work of lipins.
meanings.sent5: The lipins acted like traffic controllers, directing the flow of lipids in the body smoothly.
